medical_history.chief_complaint: Malaise and chest and abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2 weeks before presentation with gradual development of fatigue and malaise. One week prior, she experienced episodes of epigastric and periumbilical abdominal pain, more severe at night, and brief, sharp pain in the right upper quadrant. On the morning of admission, she awoke with right-sided chest pain radiating to her left arm, associated with transient diaphoresis, nausea, and shortness of breath.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of HIV infection, dyslipidemia, obesity, anxiety, depression, recurrent sinusitis, alcohol and opiate dependence, candidal vaginitis, chronic neuropathy, gastroesophageal reflux disease, herpes simplex virus type 2 and chlamydia infections, and previous surgeries for a femur fracture and endometriosis.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a student, lives in a drug-free group home, smokes cigarettes, and reports no recent raw food ingestion, exposure to sick contacts or animals, or travel.
